name: Mercury
desc: The smallest planet in our solar system and closest to the Sun.
trivia: A year on Mercury is just 88 days long.

name: Venus
desc: Second planet from the Sun. It has a thick, toxic atmosphere that traps heat.
trivia: Venus is the hottest planet, even hotter than Mercury.

name: Earth
desc: Our home planet, the only place we know of that supports life.
trivia: Earth is the only planet with liquid water on the surface.

name: Mars
desc: The Red Planet. Dusty, cold, desert world with a very thin atmosphere.
trivia: Mars is home to Olympus Mons, the tallest volcano in the solar system.

name: Jupiter
desc: The largest planet. A gas giant with a Great Red Spot storm.
trivia: Jupiter has a magnetic field 20,000 times stronger than Earth's.

name: Saturn
desc: Adorned with a dazzling, complex system of icy rings.
trivia: Saturn's rings are mostly made of chunks of ice and rock.

name: Uranus
desc: Rotates at a nearly 90-degree angle from the plane of its orbit.
trivia: Uranus was the first planet discovered using a telescope.

name: Neptune
desc: Dark, cold, and whipped by supersonic winds.
trivia: Neptune has 16 known moons, one of which orbits backwards.
